abstract: Investors are worried Google is overpaying. But new features and a high growth rate may justify a $6 billion price tag.
snippet: Investors are worried Google is overpaying. But new features and a high growth rate may justify a $6 billion price tag.
lead_paragraph: As investors fret that Google’s $6 billion bid for Groupon is too high a price to pay, new details about the company’s sales and growth suggest that it might be more like one of Groupon’s cut-rate deals.

headline.main: Google’s Bid for Groupon Portrayed as a Bargain

abstract: The search engine is trying to stop an online merchant from using tricks to get viewer hits.
snippet: The search engine is trying to stop an online merchant from using tricks to get viewer hits.
lead_paragraph: Google announced on Wednesday that it had changed the way it ranks search results so that unscrupulous merchants would find it harder to appear prominently in searches.

headline.main: Google Acts to Demote Distasteful Web Sellers
headline.print_headline: Google Acts To Demote Distasteful Web Sellers

abstract: The country’s Fair Trade Commission warned, however, that it would keep checking for possible violations.
snippet: The country’s Fair Trade Commission warned, however, that it would keep checking for possible violations.
lead_paragraph: TOKYO  Japanese regulators on Thursday approved a partnership between Google and Yahoo Japan for local Web search, clearing the way for an alliance that would control almost all of the country’s search market.

headline.main: Japanese Regulator Approves a Search Partnership of Google and Yahoo
headline.print_headline: Japanese Regulator Approves a Search Partnership of Google and Yahoo

abstract: Blu-ray players have offered Web connectivity to home entertainment systems, but the latest Internet-ready televisions have allowed device makers to build on the concept.
snippet: Blu-ray players have offered Web connectivity to home entertainment systems, but the latest Internet-ready televisions have allowed device makers to build on the concept.
lead_paragraph: TIVO started the modern home entertainment revolution with DVR technology, allowing consumers to watch the shows they wanted, when they wanted. Appointment television  shows worth building a schedule around  was obliterated.
